heading: 'world' ending
subheading: , perhaps the most venerable of television soap operas, goes off the air friday after a 35-year run, the victim of changing demographics that bode ill for the entire industry. the soaps, which have seen their ratings fall steadily for a decade now, are finding it difficult to sustain viewers as more women go to work and the likes of jerry springer vomit publicly and gobble up audience share. producers are promising a boffo finale. might as well go down with your guns blazing.
author: wired staff
text: another world, perhaps the most venerable of television soap operas, goes off the air friday after a 35-year run, the victim of changing demographics that bode ill for the entire industry. the soaps, which have seen their ratings fall steadily for a decade now, are finding it difficult to sustain viewers as more women go to work and the likes of jerry springer vomit publicly and gobble up audience share. another world's producers are promising a boffo finale. might as well go down with your guns blazing.
